resources.string: The tallest and heaviest of all living penguin species endemic to Antarctica. The male and female are similar in size, it is very common.
A penguin common along the coast of Antarctica. It is the most common penguin species.
A flightless penguin native to the South African coast. It has flattened flippers for existing in a marine habitat.
A penguin whos name comes from its distinctive yellow crest. Related to the Royal penguin.
Inhabits a variety of islands and shores in the South Pacific. Its name comes from the narrow black band under its head.
Closely related to the Adelie, they are the 3rd largest penguin species. These penguins only breed in areas of snow and ice.
This penguin is located in South Africa, along Argentina, Chile, and the Falkman Islands. Its black body and white belly hides it from predators while swimming.
One of the crested penguins much like the Macaroni Penguin. Not all experts agree on the classification of these penguins. They live in Argentina, Chile, and New Zealand.
The second largest species. There are 2 subspecies found in the South Atlantic, and South Indian Ocean.
